messages.message:
Hi, uploaded this document to converse and asked questions (in advanced mode) like "are there any contradictions in the rules in this document"? and "which of the explains have the bouwkundig rapport as a required document?"

Converse seems to be having a really hard time with these questions. It either says I can't answer this question, or returns 1 of the explains, while there are multiple that have the required document.

Is there a better way to ask the question or is this just the downside of chunking?

What is the expected answer for the first question, Timo?
cc: @vineeth
@Timo Meijrink, our current technique doesn't work well for questions that require multiple chunks to generate an answer. It works better for retrieval / extraction type of questions.

Hey @Kerry on the above, thats totally understandable based on the way we currently approach this problem. Should we expect this to change in future? Are we looking at being able to solve the multiple chunk problem?

It looks like we need more enablement here as this has come up a few times. It would be good know if the message is this is something thats being worked on, or if its an issue that will be with us for a while, as this will adjust our conversations with customers.

You should expect this to change in the future, this is in our list to improve. @Varun Jain, please make sure this current limitation is called out in the enablement.
cc @Rafal @lydia @Hari

@Siddhant I would expect either a list of rules that contradict or the conclusion that there are no contradictions, the current response was (translated from Dutch);
It is difficult to determine whether there are conflicting rules in this document without knowing the full context and content of the document. However, based on the shared text, the document appears to contain different rules and guidelines for various situations and scenarios. Some rules may seem contradictory, but they could be applicable to different situations or under specific circumstances. It is important to carefully read and understand the entire document to determine if there are indeed conflicting rules.
